positions.title: MongoDB
positions.description: Continually evaluate MongoDB capabilities with needs of IoT use cases, make recommendations to engineering teams and provide thought leadership to the executive team. Lead the architecture and strategy for MongoDB’s IoT reference architecture. Evangelize and be the customer advocate within MongoDB for the IoT use case.

positions.description: Drive demand by enabling customers to realize their potential by leveraging MongoDB database technologies. Eliminate the technical blockers in pre-sales opportunities. Work with account team to solidity account strategy plans.

given.text:
I had the pleasure of working on the same team with Rob Walters at Microsoft. We collaborated on many sales opportunities creating unified sales strategies along with our client’s participation. Rob has a unique ability to engage with customers at a deep technical level and then be able to transition to a business level conversation. Rob is the consummate professional who is focused on customer needs and success. I would welcome the opportunity to work with him again in the future.
…
See more

Rob is a walking talking encyclopedia of SQL Server knowledge. His depth on the product is amazing and he can convey that knowledge to others very well. This was very obvious when a senior director at a large financial institution went out of his way in a meeting to tell me that Rob really helped his entire team. His team was responsible for all of SQL Server across the entire company. That same person went on to talk about how they wanted to expand their use of SQL Server. Now that is impact! Rob is not a one-trick pony either. He knows a ton about security, .NET, mobile development, and many other aspects of the Microsoft Platform. I value any opportunity to work with Rob.
…
See more

received.text: Rich is by far one of the most knowledgeable person I have ever met in my 11 years at Microsoft.  He has a lot of passion around technology and does an outstanding job helping customers architect solutions!
